required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics of [14C]- BIBW 2992 MA2 in Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics of [14C]- BIBW 2992 MA2 After Administration of Single Doses of 15 mg [14C]- BIBW 2992 MA2 Oral Solution in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to investigate the metabolism and pharmacokinetics of BIBW 2992 MA2 after a single oral dose of [14C]-radiolabelled BIBW 2992 MA2 in healthy male volunteers. Metabolites in human plasma and excretions were measured, the structures of the metabolites analysed and compared with metabolites in animals. In addition, the mass-balance of excretion, the protein binding of [14C]-radioactivity, the plasma concentrations of BIBW 2992 MA2, and the [14C]-radioactivity in blood cells, plasma, urine and faeces were measured. The safety and tolerability of BIBW 2992 were also investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: [14C]-radioactivity in plasma and whole blood (CBlood cells/Cplasma ratio of [14C]-radioactivity)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: [14C]-radioactivity in urine and faeces (excretion mass balance)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 120 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of the plasma protein binding of total [14C]-radioactivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of the analyte in plasma, urine, and faeces
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax (maximum observed concentration of the analyte in plasma)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: tmax (time from dosing to peak concentration (Cmax))
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: t1/2 (terminal half-life of the analyte in plasma)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: λz (terminal rate constant of the analyte in plasma)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: AUC (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma) for different time points
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: MRTpo (mean residence time of the analyte molecules in the body after oral administration)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: CL/F (total clearance of the analyte in plasma following extravascular administration)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Vz/F (apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase following extravascular administration)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: fe0-tz (fraction of analyte eliminated in urine or faeces from 0 to the limit of the last quantifiable data point)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 120 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Aet0-tz (amount of analyte eliminated in urine or faeces from 0 the limit of the last quantifiable data point)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 120 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration time profiles of the analyte
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration-time profiles of total radioactivity in whole blood and plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 96 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: [14C]-metabolic profile and identification of metabolites in urine, faeces, blood cells and plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 120 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant changes in vital signs (Pulse rate (PR), systolic and diastolic blood pressure (BP))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 2, within 14 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant changes in ECG (electrocardiogram)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 2, within 14 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant changes in laboratory parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 2, within 14 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
Assessment of tolerability on a 4-point scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after study drug administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male subjects as determined by results of screening
- Signed written informed consent in accordance with Good Clinical Practice and local legislation
- Age ≥35 and ≤60 years
- Body Mass Index ≥18.5 kg/m2 and ≤29.9 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- History or current gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunologic, hormonal disorders
- History of any major surgery within the last four weeks before participation in this study or any bone fracture within the last two months
- History of orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells and blackouts
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of allergy/hypersensitivity (including drug allergy) which is deemed relevant to the trial as judged by the investigator
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) within 1 month prior to administration
- Planned use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial within 10 days prior to administration or during the trial
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug within 2 months prior to administration or during trial
- Smoker (> 10 cigarettes or 3 cigars or 3 pipes/day) or inability to refrain from smoking on study days
- Alcohol abuse (> 60 g/day)
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation within 1 month prior to administration or during the trial
- Excessive physical activities within 5 days prior to administration or during the trial
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range, unless considered to lack clinical reference
- Male subjects must agree to minimize the risk of female partners becoming pregnant from the dosing day until 3 months after the completion of the study. Acceptable methods of contraception for male volunteers include a vasectomy no less than 3 months prior to dosing, barrier contraception or a medically accepted contraceptive method. For female partners of male volunteers, acceptable methods of contraception include intra-uterine device, tubal ligation, hormonal contraceptive since at least two months and diaphragm with spermicide
